taskbody.context:
Overview
This procedure is a VNF maintenance operation that provides instructions on how to change in the CBAM GUI the VNFâ€™s extensions modifiable attribute by uploading the VNF Extension file prepared for this VNF.
For more information on CBAM, see CloudBand Application Manager (CBAM) documentation in the Nokia Discovery Center by going to https://doc.networks.nokia.com
Before you begin:
Before beginning this procedure, ensure the following:
You are logged in to the CBAM GUI.
The VNF Extension file has been prepared for this VNF. For more information, see section .
All the parameters in the VNF Extension file, including <sdc_config_data> parameter, must be updated before instantiation if you are installing the NCC and before SU if you are upgrading the NCC. If a parameter or a group of parameters can be updated post-instantiate and post-SU, the NCC documentation outlines this information. To modify the VNF using the VNF Extension file:

step.cmd: In the CBAM GUI, click the options button with three horizontal lines, and then select Virtualized Network Functions. The Virtualized Network Functions pane appears.

In the Virtualized Network Functions pane, select the appropriate VNF and hover the mouse over the right of the selected line, and then click the Modify button represented by the pencil icon. The General Data pane appears.
In the General Data pane, to upload the VNF Extension file, click Yes to Do you want to upload the operation parameters as a file attachment? and then click Continue. The Parameters pane appears.
In the Parameters pane, click browse and select the appropriate VNF Extension file, or use Drag and drop option to upload the file.

note.p: Each VNF requires its own VNF Extension file.
The VNF Extension file is ready for upload when the following occurs in the Parameters pane:

li.p: The name of the VNF Extension file appears in the File name area.
In the Status field, the message Ready for upload appears.

step.cmd: When the VNF Extension file is ready for upload, click Finish.

info.p: If the operation succeeds, the Virtualized Network Functions pane appears where this VNF is listed with the Last Operation Status marked as Completed - Modify Info. If the operation fails, an error message appears in the GUI.

step.cmd: If the operation fails, depending on the cause of failure, you might need to repeat this procedure. For example, if you used a wrong VNF Extension file or the VNF Extension file has errors. For more information on what to do if this operation fails, see CloudBand Application Manager (CBAM) documentation.
